info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL SCHUYLKILL... SOUTHEASTERN NORTHUMBERLAND...SOUTHEASTERN MONTOUR AND SOUTHWESTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shamokin to near Selinsgrove. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Bloomsburg, Shamokin, Mount Carmel, Danville, Kulpmont, Ashland, Elysburg, Fairview-Ferndale, Riverside, Trevorton, Catawissa, Girardville, Marshallton, Lightstreet, Almedia, Lavelle, Fernville, Englewood, Mechanicsville and Buckhorn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
